text.p: Results of four-day English county championship matches on Saturday:
At The Oval: Surrey beat Durham by nine wickets. Surrey 350-9 declared and 64-1. Durham 136 and 274 (Saqlain Mushtaq 5-111). Surrey 24 points Durham 4.
At Canterbury: Kent beat Essex by an innings and eight runs. Kent 525-9 declared. Essex 156 and 361 (P.Prichard 224; P.Strang 5-119). Kent 24 points Essex 2.

Lord's: Middlesex beat Hampshire by 217 runs. Middlesex 442-8 declared and 178-1 declared (J.Kallis 102 not out, M.Gatting 69 not out), Hampshire 306-5 declared and 97 (A.Fraser 5-38). Middlesex 22 points, Hampshire 5.

Eastbourne: Sussex beat Leicestershire by 38 runs. Sussex 330-6 declared with second innings forfeited, Leicestershire first innings forfeited and 292 (N.Johnson 74 not out, B.Smith 74, D.Maddy 61; P.Jarvis 5-44). Sussex 19 points, Leicestershire 2.

Northampton: Worcestershire beat Northamptonshire by 101 runs. Worcestershire 551 and 272-2 declared, Northamptonshire 403-5 declared and 319 (R.Bailey 115, R.Warren 67, K.Curran 55; T.Moody 5-148). Worcestershire 22 points, Northamptonshire 6.

Taunton: Somerset v Gloucestershire - match drawn. Gloucestershire 350-8 declared and 178-3 declared (T.Hancock 100 not out), Somerset 252-5 declared and 138-9 (G.Rose 67 not out; M.Ball 4-15, A.Smith 4-460). Somerset 8 points, Gloucestershire 9.
